N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8ยง 8.1 - Examinations board

State Regulations
A New York State Examinations Board is hereby created as
follows: (a) Members. The
commissioner, with the approval of the Regents, shall appoint 20 members, including appropriate representation from institutions of higher learning, high
schools, local chief school officers, and organizations of teachers, parents
and school board members. Four members shall be appointed yearly to serve for a
term of five years beginning with the first day of January next following the
ending of the term to which each, respectively, is to succeed, except that an
appointment to fill a vacancy created otherwise than by the expiration of a
term shall be for the unexpired term. (b) Powers. The Examinations Board shall
appoint, with the approval of the commissioner, committees to prepare question
papers for State examinations, and to advise with the commissioner regarding
the form and contents of syllabuses covering the subjects of study in the
elementary and secondary schools. (c) Expenses. The board shall serve without
compensation, but the ordinary expenses incident to attendance upon meetings
called by the commissioner shall be paid by the State. (d) Committees. The Examinations Board
annually, on the first Saturday of December, shall appoint committees, of two
or more members each, to prepare question papers for State examinations. An
officer of the department shall be a member of each committee. Each member
other than officers of the department shall in addition to necessary expenses
in attending meetings receive an annual honorarium. Notes
